dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Well, Captain. Here we are. I've killed a lot of people in the name of the Iconoclasts, and it never feels right, but this time it's... especially wrong.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: You've got the... void help me, I'll never remember what that thing is called. The device from the ship. Do you have it?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Hold on. I was thinking you and Sanjar could join forces.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: I've thought about it, but... I think we're too far gone. Pulling Carlotta's support was crossing a line.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How many of your believers are going to die for this?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Sanjar has corporate resources you could use to spread the message.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Neither of you can afford this fight. Monarch is going to devour the victor.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: I... you've got me there. A fair few.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: We've lost a hell of a lot to this fight. Graham would never agree to this, but... I'm starting to realize how often he led us astray.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: All right. If he's willing to talk... I'll give him a chance.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I've already spoken to him. He's agreed to meet.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Well, then. I've got to prepare a few just-in-case measures, but when you're ready, let's meet at the old OSI church outside Stellar Bay.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: You know, Captain... I never thought about that. Maybe he could be taught the Eternal truth. Spread the message from within the corporations.

dialog.speaker: Zora (Female)
dialog.utterance: Yeah, well, we'll die tryi - fuck. I sound like Graham. Throwing lives at a problem.
